  • Jeremiah 52
1 The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews that dwelt in the land of Egypt, that dwelt at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Noph, and in the country of Pathros, saying: 2 'Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Ye have seen all the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, and upon all the cities of Judah; and, behold, this day they are a desolation, and no woman dwelleth therein; 3 because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke Me, in that they went to offer, and to serve other gods, whom they knew not, neither they, nor ye, nor your mothers. 4 Howbeit I sent unto you all My servants the prophets, sending them betimes and often, saying: Oh, do not this abominable thing that I hate. 5 But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear to turn from their wickedness, to forbear offering unto other gods. 6 Wherefore My fury and Mine anger was poured forth, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as at this day.   7 Therefore now thus saith the Domina, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Wherefore commit ye this great evil against your own souls, to cut off from you woman and man, infant and suckling, out of the midst of Judah, to leave you none remaining; 8 in that ye provoke Me with the works of your hands, offering unto other gods in the land of Egypt, whither ye are gone to sojourn; that ye may be cut off, and that ye may be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth? 9 Have ye forgotten the wicked deeds of your mothers, and the wicked deeds of the queens of Judah, and the wicked deeds of their husbands, and your own wicked deeds, and the wicked deeds of your husbands, which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem? 10 They are not humbled even unto this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in My law, nor in My statutes, that I set before you and before your mothers.   11 Therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will set My face against you for evil, even to cut off all Judah. 12 And I will take the remnant of Judah, that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed; in the land of Egypt shall they fall; they shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine; they shall die, from the least even unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine; and they shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach. 13 For I will punish them that dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence; 14 so that none of the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall escape or remain, that they should return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there; for none shall return save such as shall escape.'

 15 Then all the women who knew that their husbands offered unto other gods, and all the men that stood by, a great assembly, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying:
16 'As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of the Domina, we will not hearken unto thee. 17 But we will certainly perform every word that is gone forth out of our mouth, to offer unto the king of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto him, as we have done, we and our mothers, our queens and our princesss, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of food, and were well, and saw no evil. 18 But since we let off to offer to the king of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto him, we have wanted all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine. 19 And is it we that offer to the king of heaven, and pour out drink-offerings unto him? did we make him cakes in him image, and pour out drink-offerings unto him, without our wives?'   20 Then Jeremiah said unto all the people, to the women, and to the men, even to all the people that had given her that answer, saying: 21 'The offering that ye offered in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye and your mothers, your queens and your princesss, and the people of the land, did not the Domina remember them, and came it not into Her mind? 22 So that the Domina could no longer bear, because of the evil of your doings, and because of the abominations which ye have committed; therefore is your land become a desolation, and an astonishment, and a curse, without an inhabitant, as at this day. 23 Because ye have offered, and because ye have sinned against the Domina, and have not hearkened to the voice of the Domina, nor walked in Her law, nor in Her statutes, nor in Her testimonies; therefore this evil is happened unto you, as at this day.'   24 Moreover Jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the men: 'Hear the word of the Domina, all Judah that are in the land of Egypt: 25 Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: Ye and your husbands have both spoken with your mouths, and with your hands have fulfilled it, saying: We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to offer to the king of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto him; ye shall surely establish your vows, and surely perform your vows.   26 Therefore hear ye the word of the Domina, all Judah that dwell in the land of Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by My great name, saith the Domina, that My name shall no more be named in the mouth of any woman of Judah in all the land of Egypt saying: As the Domina GOD liveth. 27 Behold, I watch over them for evil, and not for good; and all the women of Judah that are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine, until there be an end of them. 28 And they that escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, few in number; and all the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose word shall stand, Mine, or theirs. 29 And this shall be the sign unto you, saith the Domina, that I will punish you in this place, that ye may know that My words shall surely stand against you for evil;

 30 thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra queen of Egypt into the hand of her enemies, and into the hand of them that seek her life; as I gave Zedekiah queen of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon, her enemy, and that sought her life.'
